title: Towards a Simple Framework of Skill Transfer Learning for Robotic Ultrasound-guidance Procedures. (arXiv:2305.04004v1 [cs.RO])
abstract: In this paper, we present a simple framework of skill transfer learning for robotic ultrasound-guidance procedures. We briefly review challenges in skill transfer learning for robotic ultrasound-guidance procedures. We then identify the need of appropriate sampling techniques, computationally efficient neural networks models that lead to the proposal of a simple framework of skill transfer learning for real-time applications in robotic ultrasound-guidance procedures. We present pilot experiments from two participants (one experienced clinician and one non-clinician) looking for an optimal scanning plane of the four-chamber cardiac view from a fetal phantom. We analysed ultrasound image frames, time series of texture image features and quaternions and found that the experienced clinician performed the procedure in a quicker and smoother way compared to lengthy and non-constant movements from non-clinicians. For future work, we pointed out the need of pruned and quantised neural network

translated_title: 面向机器人超声引导程序的技能迁移学习的简单框架
translated_abstract: 本文提出了一个简单的技能迁移学习框架，用于机器人超声引导程序。我们简要回顾了机器人超声引导程序技能迁移学习的挑战，然后确定了适当的采样技术和计算效率高的神经网络模型的必要性，从而提出了一个用于机器人超声引导程序实时应用的简单技能迁移学习框架。我们通过两个参与者（一个经验丰富的临床医生和一个非临床医生）在胎儿模型上寻找四腔心视图的最佳扫描平面的试验，分析了超声图像帧、纹理图像特征的时间序列和四元数，并发现经验丰富的临床医生比非临床医生的动作更加迅速和平滑。对于未来的工作，我们指出了剪枝和量化神经网络的必要性。
tldr: 本文提出了一个简单的技能迁移学习框架，用于机器人超声引导程序。实验结果表明，经验丰富的临床医生在程序上比非临床医生表现更好。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a simple skill transfer learning framework for robotic ultrasound-guidance procedures. Experimental results showed that experienced clinicians performed better than non-clinicians in the procedure.
